Sofyan Basir Tinggalkan Rumah Tahanan KPK
04 Nov 2019, 18:12 by Eko Sulestyono



Sofyan Basir Tinggalkan Rumah Tahanan KPK



Sofyan Basir Tinggalkan Rumah Tahanan KPK


KBRN, Jakarta : Mantan Direktur Utama (Dirut) PT. PLN (Persero) Sofyan Basir divonis bebas oleh Ketua Majelis Hakim Pengadilan Tindak Pidana (Tipikor) dalam kasus dugaan korupsi suap  proyek pembangunan Pembangkit Listrik Tenaga Uap (PLTU) Riau-1.
Pantauan wartawan langsung dari lokasi, Sofyan Basir didampingi pengacara sekaligus kuasa hukumnya Susilo Arwibowo dan keluarganya tampak terlihat keluar meninggalkan Rumah Tahanan (Rutan) KPK pada sekitar pukul 17:50 WIB, Senin (4/11/2019).
Sebelulm memasuki mobil, Sofyan sempat mengatakan kepada wartawan bahwa dirinya mengucapkan terimakasih dan bersyukur akhirinya divonis bebas hari ini oleh majelis hakim Pemgadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor).
“Saya nggak ingin kemana-mana, hanya ingin pulang ke rumah, terimakasih” kata Sofyan Basir di Rutan Kavling K-4, Gedung KPK Jakarta, Kamis (4/11/2019). 
Tak lama kemudian, Sofyan Basir segera bergegas memasuki mobil Toyota Alhard Vellfire warna hitam dengan pelat nomor B 786 MSA dan meinggalkan Rutan KPK Jakarta.
Sementara itu majelis hakim yang mengadili Sofyan Basir sebelumnya memutuskan bahwa yang bersangkutan tidak bersalah dan tidak melanggar Pasal 12 huruf a junctoPasal 15 Undang-Undang (UU) Pemberantasan Tipikor junctoPasal 56 Ke-2 KUHP dan Pasal 11 junctoPasal 15 UU Pemberantasan Tipikor junctoPasal 56 Ke-2 KUHP.
Menurut Hariono, terdakwa Sofyan tidak terbukti memfasilitasi pemberian suap dari pengusaha Johanes Budisutrisno Kotjo kepada mantan anggota DPR Eni Maulani Saragih dan mantan Mensos Idrus Marham.
Hakim yang mengadili juga meminta agar Sofyan segera dikeluarkan dari rumah tahanan (rutan) KPK. Sofyan sebelumnya ditahan di rutan yang berada di belakang gedung merah putih KPK.
"Memerintahkan kepada jaksa untuk mengeluarkan terdakwa dari tahanan," kata hakim ketua Hariono saat membacakan amar putusan dalam sidang di Pengadilan Tipikor Jakarta, Jalan Bungur Besar Raya, Jakarta Pusat, Senin (4/11/2019).

Sofyan Basir Leave KPK Detention House
04 Nov 2019, 18:12 by Eko Sulestyono



Sofyan Basir Leave KPK Detention House



Sofyan Basir Leave KPK Detention House


KBRN, Jakarta: Former President Director (Managing Director) of PT. PLN (Persero) Sofyan Basir was acquitted by the Chief Judge of the Criminal Court (Corruption Court) in a case of alleged bribery corruption in the Riau-1 Steam Power Plant construction project.
Monitoring reporters directly from the location, Sofyan Basir was accompanied by a lawyer as well as his attorney Susilo Arwibowo and his family seemed to be seen leaving the KPK Detention Center at around 17:50 WIB, Monday (11/04/2019).
Before entering the car, Sofyan had told reporters that he thanked him and was thankful that he had finally been acquitted today by a panel of judges at the Corruption Criminal Court (Corruption Court).
"I do not want to go anywhere, just want to go home, thank you" said Sofyan Basir at the Kavling detention center K-4, Jakarta KPK Building, Thursday (11/04/2019).
Shortly thereafter, Sofyan Basir immediately rushed into the black Toyota Alhard Vellfire with license plate B 786 MSA and left the Jakarta KPK Detention Center.
Meanwhile, the panel of judges who tried Sofyan Basir previously ruled that he was innocent and did not violate Article 12 letter a juncto Article 15 of the Law (Anti-Corruption Eradication Law) in June 56 Article 2 of the Criminal Code and Article 11 juncto Article 15 of the Law on the Elimination of Corruption in Law 56 Article 56 2 of the Criminal Code.
According to Hariono, the defendant Sofyan was not proven to have facilitated the giving of bribes from businessman Johanes Budisutrisno Kotjo to former DPR member Eni Maulani Saragih and former Social Minister Idrus Marham.
The judge in charge also requested that Sofyan be immediately removed from the KPK detention center. Sofyan was previously detained in a detention center behind the KPK's red and white building.
"Ordered the prosecutor to remove the defendant from detention," said chief judge Hariono when reading the verdict in a trial at the Jakarta Corruption Court, Jalan Bungur Besar Raya, Central Jakarta, Monday (4/11/2019).
